item.title: APU Fire Detection System – Flight Deck Test System

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided an alternate procedure is established to ensure integrity of the system.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to FIRE/OVHT Test Switch: "TEST FEATURE INOP". Enter Item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: If the flight deck test system is inoperative, the following CMC ground test procedure may be used to ensure system integrity:

numlitem.para: Set either of the following switches to ENABLE position:
S2090 Remote Test Enable Switch (RCDU) at STA 400 bulkhead in the left main equipment center located near upper left side of ladder.
Set the CDU to the CMC main menu.
Press LINE SELECT key for GROUND TEST.
When screen displays ATA name and chapter, select 26 FIRE PROTECTION SYSTEM.
To initiate test, press LINE SELECT key for FIRE/OVHT TEST.
The TEST IN PROGRESS indication will be displayed for the duration of the test.
When the test is done, CDU will display TEST PASSED or FIRE TEST FAIL.

note.para: The indication FIRE TEST fail may appear as a result of circuit breaker being open on related fire/overheat detection system.

numlitem.para: If the indication is TEST PASSED, the test is finished and system integrity is verified.
If the indication is FIRE TEST FAIL, verify that following CMC messages do not appear on CDU:

entry.para: APU FIRE ALARM SIGNAL>MAWEA MM-A INTERFACE FAIL
APU FIRE ALARM SIGNAL>MAWEA MM-B INTERFACE FAIL
APU FIRE ALARM SIGNAL>EIU INTERFACE FAIL

numlitem.para: If CMC fault messages appear, seek corrective action.
Ensure S2090 Remote Test switch at the left main Equipment Center is left in the NORM position.
